2008/8/7 Nat Pryce <nat.pryce@...>:
> If you just want to test the locking, run two threads from within the
> test that each call the same method many times, 1000 or so, for
> example. When both threads have finished, the state of the object
> should be the same as if all those calls happened sequentially.
>
> It's not a perfect test since it depends on the behaviour of the OS
> thread scheduler, but in my experience this technique detects race
> conditions well enough.

I should have added, it is very important to test the test itself
because the most likely failure case is that the test passes when the
code is broken.

Remove the synchronisation and check that the test detects the race
condition, before putting the synchronisation back to make the test
pass.

If the test does not work -- that is, it does not detect the error --
you can increase the number of iterations or number of threads until
it works reliably enough.

--Nat
